subject: Re: [junit] Package Structure
msgSnippet: ... I prefer to place tests both in a separate source tree and a separate package. I have separate source trees for production code object tests end-to-end
messageBody:
Yagiz Erkan wrote:

> Hi all,
>
> I'm sure this topic must have been discussed before but I'd really
> appreciate
> your comments, or more, your personal experience concerning your test
> package
> structure.

I prefer to place tests both in a separate source tree and a separate
package. I have separate source trees for

production code
object tests
end-to-end tests
learning tests
failing tests (due to third-party software problems)

This separation makes it very easy to run each set of tests separately
using Eclipse: right-click the source folder, Run As > JUnit Test.

As for placing the test code in a separate package, I've said all I'll
ever have to say on that topic in Chapter 3 of _JUnit Recipes_. :)
